key_points: Kyle Rittenhouse, acquitted of all charges related to Kenosha shootings, to speak at Turning Point USA's AmericaFest in Phoenix.
The four-day conference will feature conservative politicians, media commentators, and musicians to celebrate America.
Andrew Kolvet, Turning Point spokesperson, emphasizes Rittenhouse as a cultural symbol of self-defense.
Rittenhouse's panel, 'Kenosha on camera', will address his involvement in the Kenosha protests.
Rittenhouse's actions have been a subject of controversy, seen by some as self-defense and others as vigilantism.
Other speakers at the conference include Charlie Kirk, Tucker Carlson, Donald Trump Jr., and Sarah Palin among others.
Controversial figures such as U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz and Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene and Matt Gaetz will also speak.
Turning Point USA, hosted by the conference, promotes free market principles and has supported Donald Trump.
AmericaFest aims to be a large celebration of constitutional rights and opposition to 'Wokism'.
Turning Point also engages in education-related political activism, opposing mask mandates and promoting reports on 'progressive professors'.
